mosimage.caption: Host Siddharth Shukla shared a pizza with the superhero turtle duo.

story.storykicker: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Donatello and Leonardo, joined the judges on India's Got Talent yesterday.
story.storybody:
The set of the popular reality talent hunt show India's Got Talent 7 had a couple of very unusual celebrity guests recently. Joining judges Malaika Arora, Karan Johar and Kirron Kher were the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Donatello and Leonardo.

Kids among the studio guests, especially were thrilled to see the their favourite toon action heroes. The idea, of course, was to promote Out Of The Shadows, the new 3D sequel in the TMNT slated for release this weekend. The toon turtles are particularly popular among children and young adults in India, and since India's Got Talent broadly includes that segment as its target audience, it would seem a smart move to reach out this way.

{mosimage} 

Also read: India's Got Talent becomes the top weekend reality TV show; here's what makes it a winner

So, in between talented contestants showing off their skills throughout the episode, Malaika was seen striking few kung fu poses with the superhero turtles. She, like her kids, seemed a huge fan of the TMNT series.

Host of the show Siddharth Shukla was seen bantering with Donatello and Leonardo, too. He shared a few bites of their favourite pizza with the superhero turtle duo amid all the frolic. Malaika, too, tucked into the delicacy.

Also read: Is Sidharth Shukla unhappy with his India's Got Talent co-host Bharti Singh?

Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out Of The Shadowssees the superhero turtle quartet of Donatello, Leonardo, Raphael and Michelangelo return with a new adventure. This time, the TMNT fighters have to thwart the attempt of a mad scientist and his evil cronies to take over the world.
